definition: to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high

sentences.english: The price of sugar soars when sugar is scarce.
Spirits soared women swooned and gods were created.
sentences.chinese: 情绪高涨，女人伉奋，灵魂驰骋。

sentences.english: Indeed, youth activism around environmental issues is growing in India.
sentences.chinese: 确实，印度应对环保问题的青年运动日益高涨。

sentences.english: The mountaineers' spirits kept up against heavy odds.
sentences.chinese: 在非常不利的条件下，登山运动员们仍然情绪高涨。

sentences.english: At the national level, net food importers may see their food import bills rising.
sentences.chinese: 在国家一级，纯粮食进口国会发现进口账单日益高涨。

sentences.english: Well, what the high gas prices have to do with a bottle of tequila?
sentences.chinese: 高涨的油价和一瓶龙舌兰酒究竟有什么关系呢？

sentences.english: Following the closure of the checkpoint, prices of commodities especially those from Thailand have increased.
sentences.chinese: 大平检查站关闭后，物价尤其是来自泰国的商品高涨。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演说者鼓动群众示威游行，抗议生活费高涨。

sentences.english: Students were all in high spirits and many students went in front of the fire to sing songs or dance.
sentences.chinese: 同学们个个热情高涨，很多同学来到篝火前载歌载舞。

sentences.english: The force of this surging water is enough to rip your facemask off.
sentences.chinese: 高涨海水的力量足以冲掉你的面罩。

sentences.english: They all set off from Acre once again, in high spirits.
sentences.chinese: 他们又一次从阿克里出发，这次，众人情绪高涨。

sentences.english: During the aftermath of the attack, patriotism was at gn all time high.
sentences.chinese: 在遭受攻击后，爱国主义情绪比任何时候都高涨。
高涨的燃料和粮食价格？

sentences.english: O storm, embodied, rising, careering with swift steps along the beach!
sentences.chinese: 啊，暴风雨已然成形，高涨，沿着海岸飞奔。

sentences.english: If morale were sky high, I would be even more worried.
sentences.chinese: 如果员工士气高涨，我还会更担心一些。

sentences.english: While Eric was singing Christmas carols , he kept waving to the pedestrians in high spirits.
sentences.chinese: 报佳音期间，孙耀威不时向途人挥手，情绪高涨。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
(of prices, rates etc) to remain high
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to increase without letup/to get worse and worse (idiom)
